Job_Title: Associate Director Digital Assets CDD Process
Job_Descriptions: Associate Director Digital Assets CDD Process About Standard Chartered We are a leading international bank focused on helping people and companies prosper across Asia, Africa and the Middle East. To us, good performance is about much more than turning a profit. It's about showing how you embody our valued behaviours - do the right thing, better together and never settle - as well as our brand promise, Here for good. We're committed to promoting equality in the workplace and creating an inclusive and flexible culture - one where everyone can realise their full potential and make a positive contribution to our organisation. This in turn helps us to provide better support to our broad client base. The Role Responsibilities This role sits in the Commercial & Corporate Institutional Bank (CCIB), Client Coverage COO organisation and is responsible for change delivery pertaining the Crypto Assets, NPM and Fintech processes and frameworks including risk management, governance and process / platform changes. Strategy The role holder is responsible for assisting with the holistic strategic roll out of the Crypto Assets, NPM and Fintech processes and frameworks through a forward-looking capability roadmap that supports the Client Coverage business plan, while staying ahead of regulations and managing the evolving risk environment for the first line through industry and stakeholder engagement. Business This role will work closely together with the Product Owner, supporting the business prioritisation of the capabilities Book-of-Work in close partnership with 2 nd line functions such as Conduct, Financial Crime & Compliance (CFFC) and Technology & Innovation, delivering maximum business value aligned to the capability strategic goals and incorporating the voice of the customer. In driving the capability business priorities, the role holder should also work closely with the Product Owner to: Clearly define and communicate; vision, scope, business case and goals to the team and stakeholders Work with key stakeholders to define, prioritise and maintain the Product Backlog Provide product / process guidance and design expertise to enable delivery of the Crypto Assets, NPM and Fintech processes and frameworks Work with vendors as necessary to ensure SCB needs are adequately represented such that the vendor product strategy aligns to SCB's medium to long term needs Contribute into the end-to-end Business architecture by defining the capabilities and services required at each stage of the client lifecycle which touches their capability/process R&R. Establish strong relationships & communication channels across each of the stakeholder areas Organise & facilitate regular scrum events/ceremonies such as the sprint planning and retrospectives. Processes / Risk Management / Governance The role holder will work closely with the Process Owner in the following: Ensuring effective roll out of the processes in line with the process control design and monitoring set out. Work with key stakeholders across all Lines of Defence (LOD) support teams to ensure capability and process requirements are rolled out in line with latest requirements & regulations. Ensuring proper change management processes being followed through and in line with the policies and standards in place, for example and not limited to, the Change Governance Policy and new Ways of Working (nWOW) Standards. Escalate risks/issues/impediments faced during delivery and articulate trade off decisions or help needed from respective Refinement Forums/QPR/MPR as well as highlighting initiative/portfolio inter-dependencies. Facilitate tracking and adoption of change against target business value/metric, articulating the contribution to Business Scorecards Responsible for managing the initiative financials and monitor forecasts against quarterly budget disbursed People and Talent To effectively manage the roll out of Crypto Assets, NPM and Fintech processes and frameworks, the role holder will work and/or lead a virtual team/squad to: Support the delivery of business initiatives that are impacting the capability, including acting as feature owners that support platform / process design decision and prioritisation. Support the consultation, review and implementation of new regulatory requirements and risks as detailed in the applicable Standards Regulatory & Business Conduct Display exemplary conduct and live by the Group's Values and Code of Conduct. Take personal responsibility for embedding the highest standards of ethics, including regulatory and business conduct, across Standard Chartered Bank. This includes understanding and ensuring compliance with, in letter and spirit, all applicable laws, regulations, guidelines and the Group Code of Conduct. Strive to achieve the outcomes set out in the Bank's Conduct Principles : Fair Outcomes for Clients; Effective Financial Markets; Financial Crime Compliance; The Right Environment. Effectively and collaboratively identify, escalate, mitigate and resolve risk, conduct and compliance matters. Key Stakeholders Client Coverage COO Management Team Client Coverage Management Team Conduct, Financial Crime & Compliance (CFCC) Reputational Risk Crypto CRO Team SC Ventures Group Operational Risk Integrated Middle Office Global Business Services (GBS) Technology & Innovation Our Ideal Candidate Degree or diploma qualified with 3 plus years of relevant experience in multiple phases of change initiatives, preferably with exposure to business project delivery roles Subject Matter Expertise in the Client Lifecycle area, particularly Crypto Assets, NPM and Fintech Client needs including industry trends, regulations, technology Experience working in an agile change delivery environment Experience in defining strategic roadmaps, and demonstrable experience in influencing priority Ability to create effective work relationships across business & borders Ability to engage effectively with senior management, regulators and auditors Excellent presentation and excel skills Knowledge of Client Coverage / Middle Office activities aligned with Corporate, Commercial, and Institutional banking an advantage Able to articulate risk clearly and in writing, for submission to Senior Leaders and Risk Governance forums. Apply now to join the Bank for those with big career ambitions. To view information on our benefits including our flexible working please visit our career pages . We welcome conversations on flexible working.

Job_Title: Digital Fraud System Manager, Fraud Risk Management
Job_Descriptions: Digital Fraud System Manager, Fraud Risk Management The Digital Fraud System Manager is responsible for managing and governing the utilisation of the Digital Fraud System that detects suspicious interactions on the Banks internet and mobile banking platforms. The role reports into the Head of the Fraud Surveillance Systems under the Group Fraud Risk Management (FRM) unit. This role drives the management and utilisation of the digital fraud system. The role will also drive subsidiary teams and ensure the optimization of the digital fraud system and related operational processes. The incumbent is expected to: Be the subject matter expert in the management and utilisation of the system, develop and oversee the operations of the system, drive and implement Group wide processes to detect, escalate and investigate suspicious interactions and interact with business and the wider fraud risk team to identify, investigate and understand current digital banking fraud trends and detection techniques; Design, implement and drive the adoption of Group-wide processes for managing digital fraud detected through the platform; Liaise with external law enforcement and internal bank departments in the analysis and response to suspicious interactions. Provide Group-wide leadership in managing digital banking fraud events. Roles and Responsibilities Work closely with FRM, internal stakeholders and law enforcement, to investigate suspicious interactions and understand current and emerging fraud trends impacting digital banking. Manage Group's digital banking fraud surveillance platform: Optimize platform detection capabilities using reports and data, key performance indicator metrics, and fine-tuning rules; Maintain platform - managing technical issues, renewal certifications, access rights management etc; Monitor and review potential fraud events alerted by the platform, and execute operational processes on escalation. Work closely with business partners and vendors on platform performance reviews. Liaise with internal and external parties - authorities and other organizations using the same platform - on best practices for digital banking fraud mitigation strategies. Provide advice to business partners on digital banking fraud risks through scheduled assessments, and recommend strategies following such assessments. Lead ad-hoc projects and support pre-deployment testing affecting the platform. Oversee and manage digital device forensic services, where necessary. Manage commercial contracts with platform vendor across the Group. Qualifications Educational and Experience Background Bachelor's degree required. Must have experience in managing digital banking fraud domains. Must have recognized certification in cyber fraud or computer fraud management including experience in digital banking fraud investigations and forensics. Must have knowledge of digital banking fraud MOs, emerging threats, tactics and techniques (e.g. usage of digital mules, deployment of financial malware). Knowledge of data analytics concepts and tools will be advantageous. Skills Fraud Investigation is advantageous. Systematic approach to tasks with good organization and planning skills. Strong problem-solving skills, with knowledge in process improvement and strategic planning initiatives. Strong attention to details in analysis of possible digital banking fraud/crime incidents. Excellent written and verbal communication skills with ability to articulate and visually present complex analysis results. Able to work independently and manage aggressive deadlines in a fast-paced environment.

Site Name: Singapore - Jurong Posted Date: Jan 17 2022 Office Location: Jurong Hiring Manager: Change Over Manager Number of internship positions: 1 Preferred Period of Internship Required: June/July to Dec 2022 Preferred Course of Intern: Bachelor in Chemical Engineering  / Industrial & System Engineering. Job Purpose Manufacturing Supply Chain Process Flow Improvement – Plant Change Over Optimisation Key Activities Do you have a strong desire to learn about what it means to get your hands dirty in a live manufacturing pharmaceutical plant? Would you like to have a first-hand experience in improving process workflows in a multi-national organisation like GSK? Would you also like to build up your social and inter-personal skills? If your answer is yes to all the above, the GSK Production System (GPS) Industrial Attachment / Internship programme is just the one for you! Based at the Jurong site in Pioneer Sector 1, you will actively participate and be involved in driving improvements to process flows across the GSK manufacturing supply chain, specifically for plant change over processes at the Jurong and Quality Road manufacturing sites in Singapore. At the end of the internship, you would expect to have experienced and accomplished the following: 1) Obtained hands-on experience with various plant activities in a live manufacturing environment for Active Pharmaceutical Ingredients, with focus on plant change over processes. 2) Actively led or participated in Kaizen sessions to develop strategies and ideas for plant change over process flow optimisation, through the use of: Analysis of plant change over performance data through data collection and mining. Application of lean principles and tools such as 5S, standard work, and Continuous Improvement @ Gemba to surface out wastes in the workflow. Advocating continuous improvement mindset and culture through engagement with various departments in the Value Streams for identification of improvement opportunities. 3) Contributed to the site’s overall continuous improvement culture by providing support to GPS Experts and personnel from other functions through the use of the GPS Framework. 4) Assisted in the coordination and facilitation of: Site-wide GPS workshops, Improvements to the KPI dashboards on site, Site/department-wide events which provide valuable experience that comes with the immersion of oneself in the GSK culture, Many other ad-hoc events that serve as platforms for ample opportunities to build a network within the GSK community. Learning outcomes: Work closely with Production, Quality, Engineering & Technical functions to develop strategies and ideas to improve process flows. Spend time in the plant to analyse processes and look for improvement opportunities. Opportunities to be exposed to lean concepts with GPS to increase productivity across the end-to-end supply chain. GSK Ideal Fit: Hungry to learn Flexible; able to work both independently and as a team Strong ability to analyze and present data Sociable, with excellent communication and organisational skills. Interested? Apply now by 6 Feb 2022 Prior to shortlisting, we will be dropping you a call to ask for your personal information and why you want to work for us. We recommend you apply as soon as possible, because we accept ongoing applications and offer positions on a first come, first served basis. At GSK we value diversity and treat all candidates equally. We strive to make our recruitment process free of bias of any kind and aim to create an inclusive workplace at GSK. If you require any assistance, either to attend an interview or during the recruitment process, please let us know. Why GSK Uniting science, talent, and technology to get ahead of disease together At GSK, we have already delivered unprecedented change over the past four years, improving R&D, becoming a leader in Consumer Healthcare, strengthening our leadership, and transforming our commercial execution. Now, we’re making the most significant changes we’ve made to our business in over 20 years. We’re on track to separate and create two new companies in 2022: New GSK with a leading portfolio of vaccines and specialty medicines as well as R&D based on immune system and genetics science; and a new world-leading consumer healthcare company of loved and trusted brands. With new ambition comes new purpose. For New GSK, this is to unite science, talent, and technology to get ahead of disease together – all with the clear ambition of delivering human health impact; stronger and more sustainable shareholder returns; and as a new GSK where outstanding people thrive. Getting ahead means preventing disease as well as treating it. How we do all this is through our people and our culture. A culture that is ambitious for patients – so we deliver what matters better and faster; accountable for impact – with clear ownership of goals and support to succeed; and where we do the right thing. So, if you’re ready to improve the lives of billions, join us at this exciting moment in our journey. Join our challenge to get Ahead Together. *Li-GSK Our goal is to be one of the world’s most innovative, best performing and trusted healthcare companies. We believe that we all bring something unique to GSK and when we combine our knowledge, experiences and styles together, the impact is incredible. Come join our adventure at GSK where you will be inspired to do your best work for our patients and consumers. A place where you can be you, feel good and keep growing. Proactively makes adjustments to manage expenditures and team resources. Job_Title: Assistant Director / Deputy Director, Insurance, Funds & Infra Finance Division (Funds)
Job_Descriptions: The Monetary Authority of Singapore (MAS) is Singapore’s central bank and integrated financial regulator. As central bank, MAS promotes sustained, non-inflationary economic growth through the conduct of monetary policy and close macroeconomic surveillance and analysis. It manages Singapore’s exchange rate, official foreign reserves, and liquidity in the banking sector. As an integrated financial supervisor, MAS fosters a sound financial services sector through its prudential oversight of all financial institutions in Singapore – banks, insurers, capital market intermediaries, financial advisors, and stock exchanges. It is also responsible for well-functioning financial markets, sound conduct, and investor education. MAS also works with the financial industry to promote Singapore as a dynamic international financial centre. It facilitates the development of infrastructure, adoption of technology, and upgrading of skills in the financial industry. Join us now, if you have a genuine interest in making an impact to help shape Singapore’s economic and financial landscape. Job Description For the legal position within funds team, you are expected to have legal training and/or experiences e.g. reviewing legal documentations. Your primary responsibility is to contribute towards the growth of the asset management industry, and to position Singapore as a global funds centre for the co-location of fund management and domiciliation activities. You will monitor global trends and developments in the industry to support the development of a new funds strategy to tap areas of growth in the sector, such as to support the development of new Singapore Variable Capital Company (VCC) structure for investment funds, to enhance Singapore’s market access network for funds distribution and to strengthen capabilities in the fund domiciliation ecosystem. You will also be actively involved in formulating and implementing strategies to engage global public investors, such as sovereign wealth and public pension funds, to add to the depth and diversity of the pool of institutional investors in Singapore. As part of your work, you will be in frequent contact with industry players to understand and analyse market trends and issues. You are expected to possess skills in competitiveness analysis and strategic planning. Job Requirements Legal training and/or experiences e.g. reviewing legal documentations or relevant legislative Acts Experience in legal practice and legislative drafting is a plus Relevant experience in asset management and/or fund servicing sector is preferred Good appreciation of business needs and market realities and demonstrated abilities to make good judgement call Excellent strategic thinking, and strong data and analytical skills Strong interpersonal skills and be able to positively influence internal and external stakeholders Effective influencing and negotiation skills Excellent verbal and written communication skills A good team player who is proactive and motivated with keen interest in strategy and developmental work Good understanding of overall financial system and asset management industry will be an advantage All applicants will be notified on whether they are shortlisted or not within 4 weeks of the closing date of this job posting.

Job_Title: Deputy Director / Assistant Director, Monetary & Domestic Markets Management Department (1-Year Contract)
Job_Descriptions: The Monetary Authority of Singapore (MAS) is Singapore’s central bank and integrated financial regulator. As central bank, MAS promotes sustained, non-inflationary economic growth through the conduct of monetary policy and close macroeconomic surveillance and analysis. It manages Singapore’s exchange rate, official foreign reserves, and liquidity in the banking sector. As an integrated financial supervisor, MAS fosters a sound financial services sector through its prudential oversight of all financial institutions in Singapore – banks, insurers, capital market intermediaries, financial advisors, and stock exchanges. It is also responsible for well-functioning financial markets, sound conduct, and investor education. MAS also works with the financial industry to promote Singapore as a dynamic international financial centre. It facilitates the development of infrastructure, adoption of technology, and upgrading of skills in the financial industry. Join us now, if you have a genuine interest in making an impact to help shape Singapore’s economic and financial landscape. Job Responsibilities The Monetary & Domestic Markets Management Department (MDD) is responsible for implementing Singapore’s monetary policy by managing the exchange rate within its targeted policy band, conducting money market operations to manage liquidity in the banking system, and issuing Singapore Government Securities (SGS). The department is also responsible for fostering the development of Singapore dollar government and corporate bond markets. As such, we are looking for an experienced hire who will be involved in the development of a new settlement and custody service for Singapore dollar corporate bonds within the Singapore Central Real-time Integrated Payments and Securities settlement system (SCRIPS). This will aid in the development of the bond market in Singapore. You will engage with industry participants and other internal and external stakeholders to ensure that the new service meets industry’s and MAS’ business requirements. You may also be involved in system development, working with IT department to incorporate stakeholders’ business needs into SCRIPS. Job Requirements Relevant work experience in securities settlement and custody service, with interest to improve the Singapore fixed income market infrastructure. Strong understanding of the business requirements of fixed income market participants of corporate bond securities settlement and custody service. Keen to gain exposure in launching a new service for the market. Strong problem-solving skills to develop effective solutions. Strong interpersonal skills, able to work well in and across teams, to drive key initiatives Good communication, writing and presentation skills. Experience in project and vendor management would be an added advantage. Commitment to public service. Applicants should be Singapore citizens. You will be working in a fast-paced environment that would require the ability to manage multiple priorities and needs of stakeholders, as well as the agility to respond to changes and developments. As part of the shortlisting process for this role, you may be required to complete a medical declaration and/or undergo further assessment. All applicants will be notified on whether they are shortlisted or not within 4 weeks of the closing date of this job posting.

He/She will also be responsible for reviewing piping engineering progress against approved schedule, for evaluating changes and taking corrective action when required, for providing technical guidance, and for organizing, executing and coordinating these responsibilities to ensure timely completion and meets project schedule and budget. Responsibilities: To study ITB, project and design basis such as scope of work, overall project schedule, basic design data, client specification, client standard drawings, existing drawings, and plot plan. To assist in planning and organizing piping engineering activities and manpower requirement for the project. To assist in developing piping engineering and design schedule, manpower requirements, manhour distribution and execution plan based on the scope of work and approved budget manhour/schedule. To coordinate piping design and engineering effort with other area Lead Engineers and disciplines of the project as directed by Piping Design Supervisor. To prepare piping information list and layout and document list following standard procedure created for the project. To prepare piping general specification inclusive of specification for piping arrangement, piping support standards. To interpret and evaluate stress/vibration analysis result and provides necessary recommendation on resolving the method of analysis. To develop conceptual routing, piping layout and piping information of major critical equipment of the project such as tower/column, airfin coolers, heaters, compressors and reactors, preferably in 3D CAD format. To check and review all work such as piping layout and information prepared by Engineers, 3D model, MTO, BQ and other deliverables of the project for compliance to project standards or specifications, applicable codes, contract requirements, quality standards and accepted engineering and construction practices. To provide field engineering support/advice towards piping installation and testing at construction site. To perform the function inherent to Piping Key Person as designated by Piping Department Manager and Lead Piping Engineer. To evaluate the performance of and provide counseling and guidance to members of the project. To prepare lesson learned upon completion of the project and recommend preventive actions to avoid recurrence on future projects to Piping Design Supervisor. To perform other tasks that may be assigned by the Department Manager and Lead Piping Engineer. To carry out engineering support work during the construction phase of the project. Requirements: Education: Bachelor’s degree of any four years BS Engineering course preferably Mechanical Engineering or at least ten (10) years related experience and/or training; or equivalent combination of education and experience. Minimum of eight (8) years in the field of piping design involving detailed design, stress evaluation, production work, 3D model review, and construction engineering support, three (3) years of which in a supervisory capacity. Skill Requirements: Ability to use computer equipment and peripherals to carry out routine computing tasks. Good Knowledge of AutoCAD. Good knowledge of SP3D. Basic knowledge of 3D Model review through Naviswork or SPR. Interpretation of stress/vibration analysis report. Ability to read, analyze, and interpret common technical information, contracts reports and instructions. Ability to respond to common inquiries or complaints from clients and ability to write effective minutes of meeting and other related business communications. Strong leadership qualities and analytical and reasoning abilities. Good interpersonal and communication. Recommended Skills Analytical Auto Cad Business Communication Communication Computer Equipment Construction Engineering

Job_Title: Asset Management Division, Global Client Business, Public Capital Market, Analyst, Singapore
Job_Descriptions: Asset Management Division, Global Client Business, Public Capital Market, Analyst, Singapore AMD Asset Management Division (AMD) is one of the world's leading investment managers. AMD provides investment and advisory solutions that span a wide range of asset classes, industries, and geographies. We extend our investment capabilities to the world's leading pension plans, sovereign wealth funds, central banks, insurance companies, financial institutions, endowments, foundations, individuals and family offices. Public Capital Market (PCM) is a new role within the GS Asset Management Asia ex Japan Client Business. The PCM team is responsible for the design, development, and management of GSAM's product range to drive the AeJ Retail strategic growth agenda. The team also provides comprehensive research on product gaps and trends, thought leadership and competitive differentiation of GSAM's investment capabilities. Product Development & Product Strategy - PCM is responsible for leading the regional efforts and centrally managing the entire product development initiative and process. PCM will liaise with key stakeholders across the region, both internal and external. This includes assessment of the business opportunity, identifying potential pain points/risks/issues early and providing viable solutions to deliver a product in a timely manner. - To lead and/or facilitate strategic product development related initiatives with other cross functional partners and build product strategies to support GSAM's AeJ business needs, with a focus on Singapore and Hong Kong Retail and Asia Private Banking channels. - Work with AeJ Client Business Teams in identifying product gaps and opportunities, capitalizing on market and regulatory developments and trends. - Develop a strong and effective partnership with the Client Business teams and maintain understanding of market needs and provide solutions that meet commercial objectives in a timely manner. Product Execution and Governance - Responsible for the liaison with stakeholders including internal parties, external legal counsel and regulatory authorities, in respect of new fund registrations and product management matters. - Operate as a subject matter expert on new products, changes to existing products or newly introduced product features, to support AeJ distribution efforts. - Keep abreast of local regulatory and industry developments and upcoming changes to global product ranges, consequently assessing the impact to the local fund registration and distribution. - Adopt and enhance regional "best practices" on product governance processes. Qualifications - Senior Analyst with overall 3-4 years of experience and relevant experience in asset management industry in a product development role is preferred. - Excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to explain complex matters in a concise and meaningful way. - Strong project management and stakeholder management skills; comfort with working across geography, time zones and functions to effectively lead or contribute in large workgroup settings. - Comfort with ambiguity and dynamically shifting priorities, timelines, and demands. - Attention to detail. Ability to multi-task, work in a demanding, fast paced environment, and handle multiple, competing priorities and projects while producing quality output - Bachelor's Degree, ideally with relevant professional qualifications such as CFA is a plus - Language competency - Fluency in written and spoken English. Fluency in Chinese and/or Cantonese will be an advantage due to business needs. To be able to organize data at both macro and micro level and provide logical data models for the consumers Database performance tuning and data lifecycle management Assist in support and enhancements of existing data pipelines and databases Requirements: Highly knowledgeable in ETL/ELT processes, both design and implementation via SSIS or some other ELT/ETL tool. 1+ years in-depth experience in working with a data warehouse and knowledgeable on data warehouse modelling techniques Good experience in building data pipelines that ingests various types of data sources into a database or data lake and populating a structured warehouse or data mart that fuels the data consumer. Fluent in both complex SQL query performance tuning and database performance tuning Have experience in building and designing data warehouses/data marts Understand the importance of performance and able to implement best practices in ensuring performance and maintainability for data-centric projects This person is required to be dynamic and be a quick eager learner as knowledge about new technologies will need to be acquired on the spot Nice to have: Some experience developing data solutions using native IaaS and PaaS solutions on AWS (Redshift, RDS, S3) is a big advantage. Experience in Streamsets or Wherescape Red is a big advantage Some hands-on experience developing data pipelines within a Hadoop-based or Apache Spark environment (solution stack is preferably Cloudera, but similar stacks considered) will be an advantage Experience in any object oriented or functional programming language is a plus How to Apply Your opportunity to empower results could start right here. Make your mark and apply online today with a brief covering letter and your resume, sharing relevant achievements for this position. Job_Title: DWS - Coverage Sales Specialist – Institutional Clients
Job_Descriptions: Details of the Division and Team: DWS Group GmbH & Co. KGaA (DWS) is one of the world's leading asset managers with EUR 820bn of assets under management (as of 31 March 2021). Building on more than 60 years of experience and a reputation for excellence in Germany and across Europe, DWS has come to be recognized by clients globally as a trusted source for integrated investment solutions, stability and innovation across a full spectrum of investment disciplines. We offer individuals and institutions access to our strong investment capabilities across all major asset classes and solutions aligned to growth trends. Our diverse expertise in Active, Passive and Alternatives asset management – as well as our deep environmental, social and governance focus – complement each other when creating targeted solutions for our clients. Our expertise and on-the-ground-knowledge of our economists, research analysts and investment professionals are brought together in one consistent global CIO View, which guides our strategic investment approach. We are headquartered in Germany but our ~3,333 employees operate globally, providing a range of traditional and alternative investment capabilities to clients worldwide. We have a fully integrated global investment group, supported by our Chief Investment Office which supplies the overarching framework that guides our investment decisions. Our investment capabilities span all major asset classes including equity, fixed income, cash and multi-asset on the traditional investment side; real estate, infrastructure, private equity, liquid real assets and sustainable investments on the alternative investment side. In addition, our solution strategies are targeted to client needs that cannot be addressed by traditional asset classes alone. Such services include insurance and pension solutions, asset-liability management, portfolio management solutions, asset allocation advisory, structuring and overlay. As a regulated asset manager, we act as a fiduciary for our clients and are conscious of our societal impact. Responsible Investing has therefore long been a key part of our heritage, because it serves the best interests of those who entrust us to manage their assets. With an over 20 year pedigree in the field of Responsible Investing, DWS was among the earliest signatories to the UN Principles for Responsible Investment (PRI) in 2008. DWS wants to innovate and shape the future of investing: with staff from 35 nationalities, speaking more than 75 languages rooted in 22 countries, we are local while being one global team. What we will offer you: A healthy, engaged and well-supported workforce are better equipped to do their best work and, more importantly, enjoy their lives inside and outside the workplace. That’s why we are committed to providing an environment with your development and wellbeing at its center. Flexible benefits plan including virtual doctor consultation services Comprehensive leave benefits Gender Neutral Parental Leave Flexible working arrangements 25 days of annual paid leave, plus public holiday & Flexible Working Arrangement Your key responsibilities: We are currently looking for a candidate who will play an instrumental role to the firm’s growth ambition in Asia Pacific, as of part of the South East Asia Institutional Coverage team. The role is to be responsible for the development & servicing of South East Asia client relationships and growth in assets under management across the product platform. This role will be based in Singapore, and the clients in focus would be South East Asia Institutional clients such as Central Banks, Sovereign Wealth Funds, Pension Funds, Insurance Companies, Endowments, Government Institutions, Family Offices, Asset Managers and Corporates. DWS in Asia Pacific has locations across Singapore, Hong Kong, Sydney, Melbourne, Taipei (through a JV), Tokyo, Seoul and Shanghai. DWS’ Southeast Asia hub office is located in Singapore. Our client specialists in Singapore have been serving the region for more than 30 years. Developing new client relationships in South East Asia Growing existing client relationships and cross-selling Detailed client mapping and wallet analysis Contribution to sales strategy and long-term planning Involvement in complete sales lifecycle, continued management and support for clients, inclusive of client servicing Preparation and communication of relevant investment, market and corporate information to clients. Monitoring of client relationships and preparation of client development plans that ensure services are delivered continuously and effectively. As required, take leadership or supportive roles in projects aimed at improving operational efficiency of the institutional platform; maintaining industry best practice and ensuring it remains in compliance with regulations. Your skills and experience: 8+ years of previous experience in financial services, in particular asset management. Experience with Institutional clients is a must. Good working knowledge and familiarity with investment concepts and securities Good working knowledge of investment management processes including operational processes Experience in handling sophisticated institutional clients at a senior level Strong working knowledge and relationship management of the SEA client landscape and institutional clients Experience and knowledge of public and private markets History of asset raising and client development Strong attention to detail, analytical and problem solving skills Relationship building, interpersonal & listening skills to interface with clients and internal business areas at an operational level. Computer skills, both numeric and creative Accurate and articulate presentation ability Strong self-starter, pro-active mindset in getting things done Team player Good time management skills Excellent language skills in English. Mandarin is optional but preferred, as the role may involve engaging with Chinese based clients in Singapore Degree holder (or equivalent level) – preferably in finance Registration with Singapore regulator to perform regulated activity 8+ years of experience including Coverage/Relationship management How we’ll support you: Coaching and support from experts in your team A culture of continuous learning to aid progression A range of flexible benefits that you can tailor to suit your needs Training and development to help you excel in your career DWS is one of the World’s leading global asset managers building on more than 60 years of experience and reputation for excellence in Germany and across the globe. As a stand-alone, publicly listed asset manager DWS has come to be recognized by clients globally as a trusted source for integrated investment solutions, stability and innovation across a full spectrum of investment disciplines including Active, Passive and Alternatives asset management. Click here to see what we do. Our values define the working environment we strive to create – diverse, supportive and welcoming of different views. We embrace a culture reflecting a variety of perspectives, insights and backgrounds to drive innovation. We build talented and diverse teams to drive business results and encourage our people to develop to their full potential. Talk to us about flexible work arrangements and other initiatives we offer. We promote good working relationships and encourage high standards of conduct and work performance. We welcome applications from talented people from all cultures, countries, races, genders, sexual orientations, disabilities, beliefs and generations and are committed to providing a working environment free from harassment, discrimination and retaliation. Click here to find out more about diversity and inclusion at Deutsche Bank.

Senior SOC Analyst Job Summary Singapore Permanent BBBH798994 Nov 22, 2021 S$100-149k Job Description Senior SOC Analyst for a leading bank in ASIA to support developing, centralising and standardising technology systems as well as banking operations. About the Department The Technology and Operations function is comprised of five teams of specialists with distinct capabilities: business partnership, technology, operations, risk governance and planning support and services. We work closely together to harness the power of technology to support our physical and digital banking services and operations. This includes developing, centralising and standardising technology systems as well as banking operations in Singapore and overseas branches. Job Responsibilities Perform deeper analysis, trending and root cause analysis of the events/incidents handled by SOC Analyst. Work on escalated security incidents (malware infections, unauthorized access, malicious emails, Phishing, Distributed Denial of Service (DDoS) attacks, etc.) Analysis of cyber threats by deep packet inspection. Detection of threat by analyzing large set logs from different security & Network devices, different Operating system, Databases, Web servers/Applications etc. Enhance and Build Cyber threat detection use cases and assist in analyzing & reducing false positive. Identify infection/compromise in the company utilizing threat intelligence and indicators of compromise (IOCs) from different threat Intel sources and regulators. Interface with Cyber Intel, Engineering and security teams. Assist in Incident Response for Detected/Reported Cyber security Incidents. Generate security reporting and metrics as required Process improvement and coaching to SOC Analyst. Stay current on the latest Cyber threats, Attacks and vulnerabilities etc. If you are interested in this position, please click "Apply Now" and we will review your qualifications & reach out to you for further discussion & next steps, if your skillsets meet the needs of the role. Only shortlisted candidates will be responded to, therefore if you do not receive a response within 14 days please accept this as notification that you have not been shortlisted. Responsible for designing and solutioning end-to-end requirements. Participate in RFPs, RFQs, RFIs and preparation of tender proposals. Provide project documentation and reports Diagnose and rectify technical issue REQUIREMENTS Minimally with Diploma in IT or with a relevant course At least 2 years of experience in Cloud Infrastructure implementation/design/solutioning Experience in Windows server OS, Unix/Linux OS in virtual environments Strong knowledge and hands-on experience with Virtualisation and Hypervisors, Nutanix platform preferred. Strong knowledge in VPN, firewalls and other security appliances Strong knowledge in network switches/routers Strong knowledge in Container technology and various platforms Deep understanding of various IT functionalities that make up a complete IT System Infrastructure Excellent written and verbal communication to convey technical ideas to both technical and non-technical audiences and contribute within a team environment Pro-active, dynamic and with good analytical/conceptual thinking Able to work independently as well as in a team and good interpersonal skills

Excellent knowledge and understanding of Liquidity Management and related Products Work experience within FRM-related areas (e.g. Treasury, Risk) or Corporate Bank business units Understanding of Financial Risk concepts and applicability to Corporate Bank’s balance sheet High commercial awareness and knowledge of Corporate Bank’s business model and products Extensive previous working experience in and working knowledge of Investment Banking / Transaction Banking cash, FX and flow market and solutions. Job_Descriptions: Senior VP, Business T&O Management - Corporate Services & Data Senior VP, Business T&O Management - Corporate Services & Data Posting Date: 13-Jan-2022 Location: Raffles Place, Singapore, SG Company: United Overseas Bank Limited About UOB United Overseas Bank Limited (UOB) is a leading bank in Asia with a global network of more than 500 branches and offices in 19 countries and territories in Asia Pacific, Europe and North America. Over this time, we have been guided by our values - Honorable, Enterprising, United and Committed. This means we always strive to do what is right, build for the future, work as one team and pursue long-term success. It is how we work, consistently, be it towards the company, our colleagues or our customers. About the Department The Technology and Operations function is comprised of five teams of specialists with distinct capabilities: business partnership, technology, operations, risk governance and planning support and services. We work closely together to harness the power of technology to support our physical and digital banking services and operations. This includes developing, centralising and standardising technology systems as well as banking operations in Singapore and overseas branches. Job Responsibilities Stakeholder Relationship Management • Acts as a single point of contact (trusted advisor) for senior stakeholders and influencers. • Supports effective business change by building relationships with business leaders, technology and operational business partners. Change Implementation Planning & Management • Anticipate the business challenges, objectives of the T&O initiatives to be undertaken, high level budgets and success criteria. • Undertake scoping and evaluation of new initiatives. Ensure early identification and resolution of challenges impacting BAU systems. Sustainable Improvements • Build a sustainable process for measuring benefits to ensure T&O resources are aligned to business initiatives which provide the highest ROI. Job Requirements Technical Skills & Experience • Minimum 15 years of relevant banking experience • Strong quantitative, analytical, problem solving and process design skills that can translate analysis into actions that meet business objectives • Understanding of technology and operational processes across functions / departments in the bank/market. • Experience in scoping and evaluation - Defining overall considerations, including scalability, maintainability, cost, operations and technology principal risk to provide a recommendation Competencies • Excellent stakeholder management and communication skills. • Manage divergent agendas and divergent stakeholders with win-win solution • Manage organizational ambiguity and differing stakeholder views • Strong understanding of business strategies and ability to translate them into concrete achievable action plans • Ability to collaborate and drive motivation across a diverse slate team members and can deal with difficult conversations • Owns and enhances workflows and processes, and delegated with clear accountabilities across the teams for delivery of outcomes • Creates and environment of learning and development through each other's success and failures. Understands and channels team members to their personal and professional growth via challenging and stretch assignments. • Strategic forward thinking approach to challenges with outstanding influencing, negotiating and persuasion skills • Passionate, diligent individual with ability to thrive in ambiguity • Resourceful team player Education • Bachelor's degree in engineering/ business/ finance or equivalent Be a part of UOB Family UOB is an equal opportunity employer. Job_Title: R0170963 CAO - Anti-Financial Crime, Principal Investigator, VP
Job_Descriptions: Posted by: Sandeep Virothu Recruiter View profile & contact Job Description Summary The Principal Investigator undertakes and participates in a wide range of investigative case work including complex, sensitive investigations within and across the relevant/assigned divisions/functions. They typically lead multi-disciplinary teams, ensuring structured, consistent and impartial investigations are undertaken to the highest levels of quality and integrity. The Principal Investigator uses a range of methods, approaches, information sources and their technical expertise, based on a robust understanding of the business and market place to achieve the appropriate outcomes, in adherence with the applicable internal policies and regulatory guidelines/standards. Job Description Additional Job Description Details of the Division and Team: Anti-Financial Crime (AFC) Investigations’ mandate is to conduct internal investigations of matters related to misconduct affecting Deutsche Bank (DB or the Bank) globally. Joining AFC Investigations offers candidates a unique opportunity to work on high priority topics whilst developing a comprehensive understanding of DB’s Global and Asia Pacific Regional platform. This is a high visibility role. We are looking to hire an experienced investigator based in Singapore to assist with both the Global and Asia Pacific Regional portfolio. Due to the criticality of the investigation portfolio as well as the high visibility vis-à-vis senior management, candidates should exhibit the highest standards of professionalism and integrity paired with proven relevant experience, leading high-impact investigations. Your key responsibilities: To lead regional and/or global investigations, taking responsibility for the end-to-end process, e.g. scoping, the use of forensic tools for data collection and analysis, conducting professional interviews and drafting high quality investigation reports. To work as part of a team, as well as independently, to run multiple investigation assignments in a timely manner, without compromising on high quality delivery. To plan and effectively manage required resources for an investigation including effective cost management. To write clear, concise investigation reports and review reports when required. To provide reports to stakeholders to reflect the circumstances and progress of the investigation, escalating issues in conjunction with the Regional Head where appropriate. To provide succinct briefings to key stakeholders on progress and outcomes of investigations and to collaborate with other functions to deliver concrete results. To understand risks associated with investigations and escalate them appropriately. To develop and maintain professional working relationships with key stakeholders, both internal (e.g. businesses, infrastructure functions) and external (e.g. law firms, consultants). To foster the development and actively support the usage of best practices in the investigation process. To assist the Regional Head with training requirements, pro-actively contributing to the development of AFC Investigations. Your skills and experience: Minimum 9 years’ experience of leading investigations in the financial services industry or corporate setting, or equivalent experience using strategies and methods for use within investigations with proven track record. International experience in leading global and regional cases. Experienced in in-house investigations (ideally experience gained in similar international organizations/financial institutions/ in forensic advisory firms) and prior experience of working in a challenging, fast-paced, international environment. A good understanding of financial services industry, an up-to-date understanding of the regulatory and legal requirements for internal investigations as well as the Bank’s control environment and compliance / regulatory topics in the financial services industry. Educated to university degree level or above with Certified Fraud Examination (CFE) or other relevant professional qualification. Experienced in leading high impact, cross-functional investigations with senior management attention. Expert knowledge of forensic tools. Strong analytical skills with the ability to think independently and to provide challenge. Ability to plan and manage budgets and to prioritize tasks to meet deadlines and expectations. Comfortable with travelling to different locations. Strong command of written and oral English is a necessity for this role. Strong team player with experience to work in diverse teams.

Job_Descriptions: Global Markets Operations, Client Due Diligence Ops, Analyst/Associate, Singapore YOUR IMPACT Our Client Onboarding Due Diligence team is seeking a professional who is looking to work with a wide variety of individuals in Institutional Sales, Compliance and Operations across the Global Markets Division to facilitate an excellent client onboarding experience and mitigate risks associated with the capture and documentation of related financial transactions. Company Description Mintable is one of the world’s leading NFT marketplace’s; founded in 2018 with its global headquarters in Singapore. Mintable is profitable, has multiple revenue streams, is well-funded and is going through a period of rapid growth. We are made up of a team of experienced professionals who are committed to building a meaningful business. We're a dynamic, agile, and gritty team that only has one goal  in mind: make Mintable the best place on the internet to mint anything! Job Description Are you a Data Scientist in search of a role in a nascent industry where you can pursue ground breaking initiatives and lead data projects that delivery clear business impact? If that's you, we might be a good match! At Mintable, we are pioneering a data-driven culture to empower our employees with timely and accurate information to drive important decision making. Working closely with the Marketing Team, you have a proven track record and will be making a huge impact, influencing business decisions relating to hundreds of thousands of customers every day in the NFT space! Reporting to the Head of Marketing (HOM), you will be a key member in the team and be heavily involved in building processes from scratch and have the autonomy to execute your data strategies. Working collaboratively with the Chief Marketing Officer and HOM, you will: Lead efforts to uncover growth opportunities within acquisitions, conversion, cross-sell, usage expansion and retention. Work with the Marketing, Product and Tech teams to own core experimentation and optimisation analytics for growth and adoption - This will involve building marketing mix models, user journey analysis, product funnel analytics, multi-touch attributions etc. Find the "story" in the data and communicate insights and opportunities to the Team. Master and be responsible for the analytical understanding of customer behaviour and business performance. Build models to better understand the value and churn behaviour of our users. Work with complex data sets and apply advance analytical methods to develop insights regarding business questions. Build predictive models and unlock insights to identify high potential users and product segments. Collaborate with key stakeholders to develop marketing dashboards and reports that generate insight, intelligence and forecast ability. Perform extended research projects on topics of interest with a focus on business impact. Qualifications To succeed in the role, we would love for you to have: 3 - 4 years of hands-on experience working as a data scientist/analyst with relevant experience preferable from an e-commerce space or consumer tech start up Strong fundamental knowledge and understanding of marketing and how data can be used for marketing decisions - making and improving marketing performance Sharp analytical skills and ability to leverage data, metrics, analytics and consumer behaviour trends to drive actionable insights and recommendations Familiar with marketing metrics such as CLTV, CAC, Conversions, Impressions, Clicks etc. Deep interest in the web3 space and are involved in crypto/NFTs Proficient in English with excellent verbal and written communication skills. A desire to own the business and build things from scratch Tech-savvy skills as we are after all a tech company! ;) Additional information What we can offer you @ Mintable? Attractive Compensation Packages 21 Days of Annual Leave Discretionary Bonus Comprehensive Health Insurance Challenging work in a fun and collaborative environment Assurance of being backed by international investors Long-term prospects for a professional career in a high growth company and up-and-coming industry Room to fail and learn from mistakes - we love failing differently and learning! Flexible work culture Frequent team lunches and company events Cozy, pet-friendly shophouse working environment in a centrally located office Referral bonuses

As a Copywriter, you are both the content maestro and the ideas architect. You should be able to work independently for any given project. Together with the suits and the designers, you work to establish key objectives and unpack the brief.  From there, you craft a sound content strategy across different marketing touchpoints (both physical and digital where required). From Branding Strategy, SEO and eCommerce copywriting, UI/UX to social media marketing, you’ve got to have a good grasp of their fundamentals and all things in between. If you’re not feeling a 100 about these, let us see how you can fit in. Key Qualities Beyond being a word distillery, you need to have a love (and mastery) for language and content Always in the know of the latest social or digital trends and exploring ways to apply within the agency or for client’s campaigns. You hate boundaries and you love scaling the walls of extremities when it comes to ideas and explorations Understand all aspects of Content Strategy, from research to strategic planning covering content sustenance. Foresight  to understand how content execution will affect client’s marketing objectives and business plans Have a set of content process plans in terms of ideation and articulating of those ideas to paper. Confidence to work independently with the suits or the creative design team. Roles & Responsibilities Branding Strategy Long and short form copywriting SEO article writing Interview stakeholders for articles/content Ideate, craft and develop content pillars as part of a digital/social media  marketing strategy Leverage your knowledge of the different social media platforms and branding plan and conceptualise content across multiple platforms Conduct in-depth analysis of ongoing social metrics as well as campaigns activations across all platforms Plan, strategise and write meaningful and quality content across different physical and digital touchpoints Brainstorm creative content and campaign ideas for both internal and our clients. Identify emerging trends and opportunities in digital/traditional landscape to create valuable insights Job Requirements Must have 1 to 3 years of copywriting experience Adept in both short form and long form writing Understand behaviours of different audiences across different platforms Moderate to advanced knowledge on marketing/digital marketing principles Great copywriting and creative thinking skills (please substantiate with portfolio) Demonstrated ability to engage effectively with a community using online media. Excellent analytical, communication, and presentation skills with ability to operate with flexibility in a fast-paced, constantly evolving and collaborative environment Understand how Google tools work and able to apply effectively to actual client campaigns (i.e. Google Adwords, Google Search Engine Console and Google Analytics) Knowledge in Search Engine Optimisation (SEO) and SEO Strategy Willing to work independently and takes initiatives to improve existing processes Take part in both private or government tenders when the need arise Strong competency in MS office and presentation skills; Relevant work experience in similar capacity preferably in marketing agencies or creative/ advertising industry; Minimally a Diploma in Marketing, Advertising/Media, Art/Design/Creative Multimedia, Film and Media Studies,  or equivalent from local polytechnics A Bachelor of Communications is also preferred, but not necessary. We are working remotely, unless there are meetings required in the office. To apply, please send your CV and education certificates.

Job_Title: AVP, Wholesale Operational Readiness Centre, Group Technology & Ops
Job_Descriptions: AVP, Wholesale Operational Readiness Centre, Group Technology & Ops AVP, Wholesale Operational Readiness Centre, Group Technology & Ops Posting Date: 14-Jan-2022 Location: SG Company: United Overseas Bank Limited About UOB United Overseas Bank Limited (UOB) is a leading bank in Asia with a global network of more than 500 branches and offices in 19 countries and territories in Asia Pacific, Europe and North America. This includes developing, centralising and standardising technology systems as well as banking operations in Singapore and overseas branches. Job Responsibilities You will be part of the Wholesale Operational Readiness Centre that supports Cash Management/ Trade Finance/ Loans/ Channels Operations Centers, with effective implementation of Technology changes, reviewing Requirements from End User perspective, and ensure implementation through effective Testing, Training and Documentation. SALARY Salary will be commensurate with experience, qualifications, and agreed work arrangements. ABOUT CHECKPOINT THEATRE Established in 2002, Checkpoint Theatre Ltd is a not-for-profit company that is supported by the National Arts Council under the Major Company Scheme and is a registered charity with Institution of a Public Character (IPC) status. We are a company of multi-disciplinary storytellers who focus on creating and presenting original Singapore content across different media, disciplines and platforms. We create, produce and market live theatrical productions, online audio and video work, and books, comics and graphic novels. Our team mentors and trains creative talents, and we run arts education programmes for schools and professional creative workshops for the public. Checkpoint Theatre turns 20 this year. We are looking to hire a senior management professional who will report to and work closely with the Joint Artistic Directors, to support and manage the team and take the company through our 20th anniversary season and beyond. We have an office team of between 11 to 15 members and we hire numerous and diverse freelance practitioners and external contractors to fill over a 100 roles for our various programmes and productions. ·      Managing and coordinating the company’s projects and teams ·      Managing and supervising contract negotiation, documentation and administration ·      Managing payrolls, staff claims, benefits and welfare ·      Strengthening, developing and implementing, and ensuring compliance with systems, processes, internal controls, policies and procedures to ensure good governance and sound operational tools, facilities and equipment, including IT hardware, software and other digital programmes and online subscription services (such as NAS, Xero, Approval Max, Justlogin) QUALIFICATIONS & Job_Title: Senior Private Banker - Singapore Team - UHNW Segment (ID 21378281)
Job_Descriptions: Senior Private Banker is a strategic professional who closely follows latest trends in own field and adapts them for application within own job and the business. Strong commercial awareness is a necessity. Is an acknowledged authority both within and outside area of expertise. Typically a small number of people within the business that provide the same level of expertise. Excellent communication skills required in order to negotiate internally, often at a senior level, and externally. Provides advanced judgment and conducts in-depth quantitative or qualitative analysis to solve problems and develop new, innovative solutions. Required to think beyond existing solutions, assumptions or current knowledge of sophisticated areas. Responsibilities: Actively identify prospects and establish contact with them/convert prospects into clients. Demonstrate an in-depth understanding of clients’ businesses and sources of wealth generation. Anticipate events in a client’s life and business which have significant financial implications. Serve as a trusted advisor to clients who frequently seek strategic advice regarding financial matters. Build relationships with client families that cross generations to establish long-term connections to the Citi Private Bank. Effectively manage client expectations regarding what can and cannot be executed on their behalf. Maintain full understanding of client goals and risk tolerance to ensure that financial strategies are appropriate. Uncover needs that are not articulated or clearly expressed by the client. Bring together the product experts to develop long-term solutions to strengthen relationships with the firm. Help clients achieve broad financial/investment goals related to the creation and management of wealth. Develop tailored solutions that address clients' investment, risk management, and financing/liquidity needs. Set challenging goals, regularly monitoring progress and making adjustments to achieve objectives. Plan and prioritize daily, weekly, and monthly activities to maximize revenue growth and client satisfaction. Establish a referral network and gain introductions to potential clients which generate new sales. Close the deal, making concessions that are appropriate and in line with the fundamental interests of the Citi Private Bank. Help team members acquire the experience necessary to establish credibility with clients and intermediaries. Demonstrate strong commitment to team success and place team goals above personal achievement. Encourage team members to work together to deepen client relationships and exceed sales goals. Align complementary experiences and skill sets of team members to maximize client effectiveness. Build relationships/partner with support groups in Citi Private Bank to maintain control, find solutions and resolve issues. Follow standard procedures and advocate appropriate exceptions to standard practices when the bigger picture needs to be considered, and seek or grant approvals as appropriate. Ensure compliance on regulatory requirements and minimizes any potential liability for Citi. Ensure strong controls and effective operational and administrative services. Partner with colleagues across the Citi network to leverage capabilities and share expertise. Ensure clients are presented with seamless execution of internal processes and Citigroup services. Prioritize issues that need to be escalated, getting the appropriate people involved to expedite resolution. Understand and communicate the risk involved with various investment strategies. Establish credibility and trust with all Citi Private Bank colleagues, maintaining the highest standards of personal and professional integrity. Flag and report illegal or improper transactions, complying with all regulatory policies and control procedures regarding client acceptability. Understand the broad array of products and services under the Citi umbrella. Apply an in-depth level of knowledge in key investment and financing products. Develop expertise to identify business opportunities and address the unique needs of specific client segments. Appropriately assess risk when business decisions are made, demonstrating particular consideration for the firm's reputation and safeguarding Citigroup, its clients and assets, by driving compliance with applicable laws, rules and regulations, adhering to Policy, applying sound ethical judgment regarding personal behavior, conduct and business practices, and escalating, managing and reporting control issues with transparency. Qualifications: 15+ years of experience CACS Papers 1 and 2 Extensive and proven experience in Private Banking having covered the Singapore UHNW market / Extensive experience in working with and/or leading client teams and transactions / Demonstrated track record in relationship selling Education: Bachelor's/University degree, Master's degree preferred ------------------------------------------------- Job Family Group: Private Client Coverage ------------------------------------------------- Job Family: Private Banker ------------------------------------------------------ Time Type: ------------------------------------------------------ Citi is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. At Glints, we are building the #1 tech-enabled recruitment and career discovery platform in Southeast Asia that helps people and organisations realise their human potential by joining great organisations, learning the right skills and building great teams. We’re looking for a Product Marketing Manager, Singapore to join our International Markets Product Marketing team, to enable Glints to be the preferred platform and service for offshore recruitment and managed talent solutions. The Product Marketing Manager will lead and execute the full-funnel marketing strategies in the Singapore market, ensuring an effective market penetration for Glints. They will drive demand generation for Singapore and execute various strategies from creating awareness, acquiring, retaining, and increasing the LTV of customers to achieve high-quality leads for the business. What You'll Be Doing Scale and enhance effectiveness of demand generation marketing strategy: Increase awareness and credibility of Glints amongst employers in Singapore by developing scalable marketing strategies and initiatives and ensuring that Glints is the leading and trusted voice in the tech, digital talent and remote hiring space. This includes developing a full-funnel omni-channel demand generation marketing strategy that will sustainably deliver high quality marketing qualified leads in increasing volume and decreasing costs. Achieve excellence in execution and operations of marketing strategies: Collaborate with various stakeholders to ensure marketing campaigns and initiatives are executed and managed at the highest level of excellence, and are effectively driving impact for the business. This includes conducting experiments and tests to validate and optimise ideas, audience segmentation, messaging, channels and costs needed to scale-up demand generation initiatives. Milk local partnerships and build engaged local communities of employers: Plan and execute effective partnership activities by leveraging existing and new strategic and community partners to increase the credibility, awareness, demand of Glints solutions. Drive conversations and ongoing management of employer community engagement channels and programs (both owned and partnered), by leveraging on content, events, etc. Enable and support Sales: Support SDR, BD, and CSM teams' productivity by developing leads database, sales pitch decks, and playbook to drive sales opportunities and improve SQL to win conversion rate Why You Should Join Us Key strategic role and contributor: You are empowered to develop the most effective strategy to win the market alongside your immediate team; Pioneer and champion your market: Be the first to enable Glints to become an important market solution for various companies, enterprises and start-ups. Who We Are Looking For At least 3 years of relevant working experience in start-ups or in-house marketing positions with experience in B2B demand-generation marketing roles; Strong hands-on experience in omnichannel, full-funnel marketing; Proven project management experience; Keen understanding of the Singapore market and its enterprises and startups alike; Results and data-driven with a keen interest in numbers and the ability to use them to make key strategic decisions; Strong drive to growth-hack various marketing strategies and initiatives; Creative and always looking for ways to develop the best marketing campaign; Ability to see the bigger picture and highly motivated by understanding the core "whys"; Authentic, humble and honest, with a flair in communications and stakeholder management in order to gain buy-ins, support and collaboration from decision-makers and stakeholders; Attention to detail with the inclination to over-communicate ideas, processes and structures; Relentless and resourceful and always up for challenges in a fast-paced environment. Let’s Realise Human Potential. We have impacted many lives since we were founded in 2013, but there’s still plenty to be done. If you’re ready to grow and make an impact, you’ve come to the right place. What is Glints? Glints is an online talent recruitment and career discovery platform with the enduring purpose of contributing to a world where people and organisations can realize their human potential. Our tech-enabled approach to recruitment and career discovery connects more than 1.5 million candidates to their next dream opportunities, has supported more than 30,000 companies in finding top talents, doubled recruiter efficiency, and has raised more than US$30M+ from best venture investors in Asia to date. Our agility and firm hold on our core purpose and values have allowed us to remain resilient and thrive through tumultuous times, and we are proud to be recognised by LinkedIn as one of the Top 10 Startups in Singapore in 2020. Who We Are At Glints, personal and professional growth are just as important as business growth. That's why we created the Glints Culture Code: #RIIBCOH . It defines our values, guides our decisions and actions, and is what makes us special. Relentlessly Resourceful: Whatever it takes, just make it happen (ethically) Integrity: Have courage, be guided by the truth, don’t be afraid Impact: Missionaries, not mercenaries Beginners’ Mindset: Stay humble, don’t be attached to ego Customer Obsessed: Customers First Ownership: Care intensely about the mission and take responsibility High Standards: Dream big and deliver epic outcomes fast Where We Work Glints operates in multiple locations across Greater Southeast Asia, including Singapore, Indonesia, Vietnam, Taiwan and Malaysia. Learn more about Glints and our culture at bit.ly/glintsculture .

Narrators is an AI-powered web and mobile marketing platform designed to scale influencer marketing with micro and macro-influencers. Primarily headquartered in Singapore, Narrators is now the leading micro-influencer marketing platform in Asia and boasts of a synergized team spread across the different markets it operates in: Singapore, Malaysia, Thailand, Hong Kong, Korea, Philippines, Taiwan, and Indonesia. Our main mission is to generate social content, reach, engagements, and social commerce at scale by matching brands and social media creators. We strive to leverage data and technology to gain marketing efficiencies and in the process, improve the livelihood of the largest community of social media content creators. As a Community Success Intern at Narrators, you will be responsible to work with the account management teams in the management of clients’ expectations and the execution of contract deliverable through the community of influencers you’re managing. Your main goals are to create and execute best in class influencer marketing campaigns, and to grow and retain the influencer community on Narrators. Here is a non-exhaustive list of the main tasks you will be responsible to execute: Campaign Management Maintain oversight of clients’ overall campaign timelines to ensure deadlines and milestones are met and delivered Campaign Performance – Manage day-to-day execution and running of campaigns with the community, to fulfil reach and engagement of at least 100% of signed KPI of campaigns Campaign Margin – Work closely with the Business Development and Client Success teams to manage campaign spending Prepare and present reporting to clients Manage internal and external resources to execute deliverables Participate in client meetings Support the ideation, proposal preparation and pitching process with potential clients Community Management Exude passion for the Narrators brand and be a walking role model for the type of community that the company wants to attract. Community Research – Being able to gather community feedback and analytics to make actionable insights that the company can react to Rallying Cry – Becoming the internal rally cry and the conscience of the community/ customer inside the company and identifying processes that hinder community success Influencer Communication/Liaison – Playing the intermediary role between company and community, whether it is planned or crisis communication, and highlighting emerging issues as well as providing strong governance Strategy – Help develop new methods for community engagement that also benefits clients, manage the website, brand portal and platform Recruitment and Outreach – Recruit new influencers into the community wherever they exist and giving back on social media to top performing community members. Recruit qualified and eligible influencers based on client’s criteria for each campaign. Who are we looking for? Must be able to commit full-time, 6 months preferred Strong interest in social media & marketing Excellent verbal and written communication skills Takes initiative in the role, and is able to think outside the box Attention to details A spontaneous individual with a positive attitude, enjoys working in a fast-paced start-up environment

Orion Marketing Group is on a mission to provide world-class service to boost the revenue of our multinational clients. We are expanding and are very keen to grow beyond Singapore shores.
